lead_paragraph: An investigation found that one of the men pictured was not John Bradley, a focus of the book “Flags of Our Fathers,” but a private first class named Harold Schultz.

byline.contributor: Kitty Bennett and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

headline.print_headline: Man in Photo of Iwo Jima  Misidentified, Marines Say
headline.main: Man in Iwo Jima Flag Photo Was Misidentified, Marine Corps Says

snippet: An investigation found that one of the men pictured was not John Bradley, a focus of the book “Flags of Our Fathers,” but a private first class named Harold Schultz.
abstract: Marine Corps investigation finds that Private First Class Harold Schultz was one of six men in iconic photograph of flag being raised over Iwo Jima during World War II, and Navy hospital corpsman John Bradley was not in image as has been believed for decades; investigation followed inquiry by producers of upcoming Smithsonian channel documentary The Unknown Flag Raiser of Iwo Jima.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
